column4: I think what I need to find is the preference file regarding which windowing method to use and try to change it back to classic
metacity is the default window decorator for gnome
ok, thanks, I'll give it a go
well, I created a launcher on the desktop and put 'metacity --replace' as the command, but when I run it, nothing seems to change
you're probably using metacity already.. what are your original troubles?
well, when I startup, I only get desktop, no panels or UNR nav windows, so I basically can only use the computer by creating launchers on the desktop, which is kind of a pain
you could create a new user and see if the problems persist. if not you've got a configuration issue with your current account
yeah. more than likely you've deleted them.. good luck
if on  a reboot they are gone again you can add gnome-panel to sessions
I just switched it back to UNR window mode, I think the problem is UNR doesn't have gnome-panel in startup, and changing to classic mode doesn't add it
i'm seeing similiar complaints on the forums. look at  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1136323
